course_title: Foundational Social Work Field Practice Course in Health and Ageing

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the socio-political context within which health social work is practiced and the major debates and trends relevant to practice.

Demonstrate a critical awareness of the major theoretical and knowledge bases that frame and challenge social work in different health settings and the implications for practice with individuals and families.

Demonstrate critical awareness of the diversity of health experiences across the lifespan incorporating gender, identity, class, ethnicity, and geography and the implications for social work practice.
Demonstrate competence at a foundational level in psychosocial assessment and intervention skills with individuals and families across a range of practice settings.
Demonstrate a competence in professional communication for health social work at a foundation level.

assessments.task_description:
This description is a summary of the task. For full details, including the marking rubric, please refer to the course Learn UQ (Blackboard) site.

Psychosocial assessments are core social work practice and a reflection of competence in relationship and process skills as well as analytic and reasoning skills. A psychosocial assessment is a key mechanism for developing an analysis of the ‘person-in-context’, an appropriate intervention plan, and is effective for communicating the social work role to other health care professionals.

This task involves observing a social work interview during the lecture and tutorial in Week 9 and completing a written psychosocial assessment based on your observation of the interview.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment requires students to submit an electronic version of their assignment via Blackboard. The electronic version of your assignment will be submitted via Blackboard, using the Turnitin software.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
End of Semester Exam Period

8/11/2025 - 22/11/2025

The end of semester exam will be held on campus. The exam is a closed book exam.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Social Determinants of Health (Wk 1)

Welcome to this course. The week's lecture covers:

  1. The Social Determinants of Health. Inequities in access to health care.
  2. Life Course perspective.
  3. Vulnerable groups.

A separate video will set out an overview of the course, expectations, modes of delivery, and assessment.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Social Determinants of Health (Wk 1) Welcome to this course. The week's lecture covers: The Social Determinants of Health. Inequities in access to health care. Life Course perspective. Vulnerable groups. A separate video will set out an overview of the course, expectations, modes of delivery, and assessment.

learning_activities.topic:
Social Determinants of Health (Wk 1)

In this tutorial we will:

  1. Discuss the use of case examples to assist with understanding the social determinants of health.
  2. View a video and in groups consider key concepts in life course theory including key events, trajectories, and linked lives.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Social Determinants of Health  (Wk 1) In this tutorial we will: Discuss the use of case examples to assist with understanding the social determinants of health. View a video and in groups consider key concepts in life course theory including key events, trajectories, and linked lives.

learning_activities.topic:
Social Work Role in Health (Wk 2)

This week's lecture includes:

  1. Core areas of expertise
  2. Theories used in practice
  3. Skills in practice

We will also contextualise practice with a consideration of the Australia's health care system. We will consider strengths and challenges within Australia's health care.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Social Work Role in Health (Wk 2) This week's lecture includes: Core areas of expertise Theories used in practice Skills in practice We will also contextualise practice with a consideration of the Australia's health care system.  We will consider strengths and challenges within Australia's health care.

learning_activities.topic:
Social Work Role in Health (Wk 2)

Following on the lecture we will consider practice with older people in the community - we will watch a film and then in groups discuss the practice issues and social work role.

Following on the lecture's consideration of theories informing social work in health we will work through a number of case studies and consider relevant theories.

We will work through a group exercise in relation to evidence based practice following a natural disaster.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Social Work Role in Health (Wk 2) Following on the lecture we will consider practice with older people in the community - we will watch a film and then in groups discuss the practice issues and social work role. Following on the lecture's consideration of theories informing social work in health we will work through a number of case studies and consider relevant theories. We will work through a group exercise in relation to evidence based practice following a natural disaster.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills-Legal Ethical Issues (Wk 3)

This week's lecture considers a range of medico-legal issues that arise in health care.

These include:

  1. Consent (and self determination)
  2. Confidentiality and Privacy
  3. Capacity and decision-making.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills-Legal Ethical Issues (Wk 3) This week's lecture considers a range of medico-legal issues that arise in health care. These include: Consent (and self determination) Confidentiality and Privacy Capacity and decision-making.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills-Legal Ethical Issues (Wk 3)

In this tutorial we will work through a number of case studies to assist in understanding issues relating to:

  1. Consent
  2. Privacy and confidentiality
  3. Impaired decision making
  4. Guardianship and Administration with the use of case examples.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills-Legal Ethical Issues (Wk 3) In this tutorial we will work through a number of case studies to assist in understanding issues relating to: Consent Privacy and confidentiality Impaired decision making Guardianship and Administration with the use of case examples.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills-Legal Ethical Issues (Wk 4)

In this lecture we will be discuss a range of legal documents including EPOA and AHD. The role of QCAT will also be discussed.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills-Legal Ethical Issues (Wk 4) In this lecture we will be discuss a range of legal documents including EPOA and AHD. The role of QCAT will also be discussed.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills-Legal Ethical Issues (Wk 4)

In this tutorial we will work through case examples involving EPOA and AHD; and the role of QCAT, Guardians and Administrators.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills-Legal Ethical Issues (Wk 4) In this tutorial we will work through case examples involving EPOA and AHD; and the role of QCAT, Guardians and Administrators.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills - Transitions (Wk 5)

This week's lecture considers transitions. In particular we consider transitions in individual's (and family's) lives linked to diagnosis, adjustment to frailty and disability.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills - Transitions (Wk 5) This week's lecture considers transitions. In particular we consider transitions in individual's (and family's) lives linked to diagnosis, adjustment to frailty and disability.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills - Transitions (Wk 5)

We will aim to understand using case studies (documentaries) the nature of transitions and social work responses with:

  1. Dementia
  2. Brain Injury

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills - Transitions (Wk 5) We will aim to understand using case studies (documentaries) the nature of transitions and social work responses with: Dementia Brain Injury

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills - Grief & Loss (Wk 6)

This week's lecture focuses on working with grief & loss in health settings.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills - Grief & Loss (Wk 6) This week's lecture focuses on working with grief & loss in health settings.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills - Grief & Loss (Wk 6)

Following on from the grief lecture we will consider in groups social work practice with families after stillbirth. We will use a recorded case study.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills - Grief & Loss (Wk 6) Following on from the grief lecture we will consider in groups social work practice with families after stillbirth. We will use a recorded case study.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills-Psychosocial Assessment (Wk 7)

This week's lecture covers

  1. The principles of engaging with clients
  2. Theory and frameworks for psychosocial assessments in health practice.

The lecture and tutorial are the only resources for this topic.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills-Psychosocial Assessment (Wk 7) This week's lecture covers The principles of engaging with clients Theory and frameworks for psychosocial assessments in health practice. The lecture and tutorial are the only resources for this topic.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills - Psychosocial Assessment (Wk 7)

Following on the from the lecture we will work through a video undertaking a psychosocial assessment using a template. We will stop the film and discuss at all relevant points to enable understanding the components of the assessment. Please note this is not the video used for Assignment 2.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills - Psychosocial Assessment (Wk 7) Following on the from the lecture we will work through a video undertaking a psychosocial assessment using a template. We will stop the film and discuss at all relevant points to enable understanding the components of the assessment. Please note this is not the video used for Assignment 2.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills-Psychosocial Assessment (Wk 8)

This week's lecture covers in detail the Assessment, Intervention, and Plan sections of a psychosocial assessment.

The lecture and tutorial are the only resources for this topic.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills-Psychosocial Assessment (Wk 8) This week's lecture covers in detail the Assessment, Intervention, and Plan sections of a psychosocial assessment. The lecture and tutorial are the only resources for this topic.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills-Psychosocial Assessment (Wk 8)

Following on from the lecture we will work through the same video we watched last week. We will work through in detail the Assessment, Intervention, and Plan sections of the psychosocial assessment relating to the person's circumstances in the video.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills-Psychosocial Assessment (Wk 8) Following on from the lecture we will work through the same video we watched last week. learning_activities.topic:
Demonstration of Pyschosocial Assessment (Wk 9)

A video of an interview will be shown - attendance is COMPULSORY as you are viewing the video required for Assignment 1 Psychosocial Assessment. We will have one interactive session (starting at normal lecture time and continuing through tutorial time) to work through the video. We will have rest breaks. PLEASE NOTE there is no lecture or tutorial in addition to the demonstration of the psychosocial assessment.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills - Trauma (Wk 11)

In this lecture we will consider life changing events and trauma in health sectors.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills - Trauma (Wk 11) In this lecture we will consider life changing events and trauma in health sectors.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills - Trauma (Wk 11)

Following on from the lecture on trauma we consider the social work role in relation to sexual assault.

We will break out in groups to undertake the discussion and tasks.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Knowledge & Skills - Trauma (Wk 11) Following on from the lecture on trauma we consider the social work role in relation to sexual assault. We will break out in groups to undertake the discussion and tasks.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills - Elder Abuse (Wk 12)

In this lecture we will discuss elder abuse. We will consider:

  1. Understanding forms of elder abuse
  2. Practice frameworks
  3. Legal ethical issues

Learning outcomes: L03, L04, L05

Following on the lecture we will work through in groups case studies where elder abuse is a presenting issue. We will also consider referral pathways and resources.

learning_activities.topic:
Knowledge & Skills - Acute Care; Communication (Wk 13)

In this lecture we will focus on two sections.

  1. Acute care. We will have a guest speaker discussing work in Intensive Care.
  2. We will discuss the importance and essential elements of written communication in health settings including case notes, referrals & team presentations.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05

We will also undertake exam preparation.
